comment.author: 84256344@N00
comment._content: Huge crowd and amazing positioning by Moore in all his shots. Im trying to figure out where this is. Is it somewhere in Newtown or the Basin Reserve?

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content: Hi rambla This is one of my favourites of this series - there's something truly epic about it. You're right about it being near the Basin Reserve; the location is the grounds of St Patrick's College (which was founded by Archbishop Redwood). The College was originally located on Cambridge Terrace, and in 1979 moved to its present location in Kilbirnie. History of St Patrick's College This photograph on Timeframes gives another view of the same event. I'll keep hunting around and see if I can come up with a more specific address. cheers, Courtney
comment.authorname: National Library NZ on The Commons

comment.author: 30394191@N04
comment._content: St Patrick's appears on the right in this photo from the other direction, probably taken from the top of Mt Victoria. In the centre is the former Mt Cook prison, standing on the site of what would be the Dominion Museum, now part of Massey University. mp.natlib.govt.nz/detail/?id=23733&recordNum=84&f...|placeid%2465066&l=en You can see the Basin Reserve and Cambridge and Kent Terraces head away from the Basin to the right of the picture. Note link near the bottom of the page to the zoomable archive image.
